name: Body Scan Meditations
description: Progressive relaxation technique. Systematically notice and release tension throughout body. Evidence-based for stress, pain, and sleep.

exercises.name: Quick Body Scan (10min)
exercises.description: Brief scan of major body areas
exercises.instructions: Lie down. Starting at feet, move attention up body: feet, legs, hips, belly, chest, arms, hands, shoulders, neck, face, head. Notice sensations. Release tension.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Before bed, desk breaks, after workouts
exercises.scienceBacked: MBSR protocol, proven for pain management and stress

exercises.name: Full Body Scan (20min)
exercises.instructions: Lie down comfortably. Spend 1-2min on each area: toes, feet, ankles, calves, knees, thighs, hips, pelvis, lower back, belly, chest, upper back, shoulders, arms, hands, fingers, neck, jaw, face, scalp. Release tension as you go.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Evening relaxation, chronic pain management, insomnia
exercises.mbsrStandard: This is the classic MBSR body scan used in clinical settings

exercises.name: Body Scan for Sleep (15min)
exercises.description: Designed specifically for falling asleep - slow, soothing
exercises.instructions: In bed, lights off. Very slowly scan from toes to head. As you notice each area, intentionally soften and release. Let awareness drift - falling asleep during this is success.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Insomnia, racing thoughts at bedtime, chronic sleep issues
exercises.guidance: It's OK to fall asleep - that's the goal. If you wake up later, start again from wherever you remember

exercises.name: Seated Body Scan (12min)
exercises.description: Can be done at desk or in chair - work-friendly
exercises.instructions: Sit upright but relaxed. Scan from feet to head while seated. Notice contact with chair, pressure points. Release unnecessary tension in face, shoulders, hands.
exercises.bestUsedFor: Work breaks, when lying down isn't possible, midday reset
exercises.discrete: Can be done in office with eyes open if needed
